functions.name: SetParticleCullRadius
functions.description: The function name has not much in common with its actual function, it applies a radius to every particles that affects the building of the bounding box, as it, usually is constructed by the particle that has the lowest x, y and z and the highest x, y and z, this function just adds/subtracts the radius and inflates the bounding box.

functions.name: Approach
functions.description:
Sets the location we want to get to.

Each call of <page text="Approach">CLuaLocomotion:Approach</page> moves the <page text="NextBot">NextBot</page> 1 unit towards the specified goal. The size of this unit is determined by <page text="SetDesiredSpeed">CLuaLocomotion:SetDesiredSpeed</page>; the default is `0` (each call of <page text="Approach">CLuaLocomotion:Approach</page> moves the <page text="NextBot">NextBot</page> 0).

To achieve smooth movement with <page text="Approach">CLuaLocomotion:Approach</page>, it should be called in a hook like <page text="Think">ENTITY:Think</page>, as shown in the example.

arguments.name: goal
arguments.description: The vector we want to get to.

arguments.name: goalweight
arguments.description: If unsure then set this to `1`.

This value will always be between 0 and <page>CLuaParticle:GetDieTime</page>.


It changes automatically as time goes.

It can be manipulated using <page>CLuaParticle:SetLifeTime</page>.


If the life time of the particle will be more than <page>CLuaParticle:GetDieTime</page>, it will be removed.

returnValues.description: How long the particle existed, in seconds.

arguments.name: endAlpha

functions.description:
Sets the 'life time' of the particle, how long the particle existed since its creation.

This value should always be between 0 and <page>CLuaParticle:GetDieTime</page>.


It changes automatically as time goes.


If the life time of the particle will be more than <page>CLuaParticle:GetDieTime</page>, it will be removed.

arguments.name: lifeTime
arguments.description: The new life time of the particle.

Think function. It has only one argument:


<page>CLuaParticle</page> particle - The particle the think hook is set on

functions.name: GetAdjacentCountAtSide
functions.description:
Returns the amount of <page>CNavArea</page>s that have a connection ( one or two way ) **from** this <page>CNavArea</page> in given direction.

See <page>CNavArea:GetAdjacentCount</page> for a function that returns <page>CNavArea</page> count from/in all sides/directions.

arguments.name: navDir
arguments.description: The direction, in which to look for <page>CNavArea</page>s, see <page>Enums/NavDir</page>.

returnValues.description: The amount of <page>CNavArea</page>s that have a connection ( one or two way ) **from** this <page>CNavArea</page> in given direction.

functions.name: GetIncomingConnectionDistances
functions.description:
Returns a table of all the <page>CNavArea</page>s that have a one-way connection **to** this <page>CNavArea</page> and their pre-computed distances.

If a <page>CNavArea</page> has a two-way connection **to or from** this <page>CNavArea</page> then it will not be returned from this function, use <page>CNavArea:GetAdjacentAreaDistances</page> to get outgoing (one and two way) connections.

arguments.name: dir
arguments.description: If set, will only return areas in the specified direction. See <page>Enums/NAVDIR</page>.

returnValues.description:
A list of tables in the following format:
* <page>CNavArea</page> **area** - the area that is connected to this area.
* <page>number</page> **dist** - Distance from the area to this area.
* <page>number</page> **dir** - Direction in which the area is in relative to this area.

functions.name: IsDamaging
functions.description: Returns whether the <page>CNavArea</page> would damage if traversed, as set by <page>CNavArea:MarkAsDamaging</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether the area is damaging or not

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The position to test.

arguments.name: ignoreEnt
arguments.description: If set, the given entity will be ignored when doing LOS tests

returnValues.description: Whether the given position is visible from this area

functions.name: IsRoughlySquare

functions.name: SetTotalCost

More information can be found on the <page>Simple Pathfinding</page> page.

arguments.name: cost

The total cost of the path to set.

Must be above or equal 0.

name: Color
description:
List of all possible functions to manipulate colors.

Colors are implemented in Lua thus <page>Global.type</page>(color) == "table" and <page>Global.TypeID</page>(color) == <page text="TYPE_TABLE">Enums/TYPE#table</page>.

For type checking use <page>Global.IsColor</page>.

Created by <page>Global.Color</page>, <page>Global.HSVToColor</page>, and <page>Global.HSLToColor</page>.

| Type                | Name  | Description                       |
| ------------------- | ----- | --------------------------------- |
| <page>number</page> | **r** | The red component of the color.   |
| <page>number</page> | **g** | The green component of the color. |
| <page>number</page> | **b** | The blue component of the color.  |
| <page>number</page> | **a** | The alpha component of the color. |

functions.name: SetUnpacked
functions.description: Sets the red, green, blue, and alpha of the color.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: The red component

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: The green component

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: The blue component

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: The alpha component

functions.name: GetBool
functions.description: Tries to convert the current string value of a <page>ConVar</page> to a boolean.

returnValues.description: The boolean value of the console variable. If the variable is numeric and not 0, the result will be `true`. Otherwise the result will be `false`.

functions.name: GetFlags
functions.description: Returns the <page>Enums/FCVAR</page> flags of the ConVar

returnValues.name: flag
returnValues.description: The bitflag. See <page>Enums/FCVAR</page>

functions.name: GetName
functions.description: Returns the name of the <page>ConVar</page>.

returnValues.description: The name of the console variable.

functions.name: SetFloat
functions.description:
Sets a ConVar's value to the input number.
<note>This can only be ran on ConVars created from within Lua.</note>

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Value to set the ConVar to.

functions.name: RemovePAS

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: The position to test

functions.name: RemovePlayer
functions.description: Removes the player from the recipient filter.

arguments.name: Player
arguments.description: The player that should be in the recipient filter if you call this function.

functions.name: ChangePitch
functions.description:
Adjust the pitch, alias the speed at which the sound is being played.

This invokes the <page>GM:EntityEmitSound</page>.

arguments.name: pitch
arguments.description: The pitch can range from 0-255. Where 100 is the original pitch.

arguments.name: deltaTime
arguments.description: The time to fade from previous to the new pitch.

functions.name: ChangeVolume
functions.description:
Adjusts the volume of the sound played.
Appears to only work while the sound is being played.

arguments.name: volume
arguments.description: The volume ranges from 0 to 1.

arguments.name: deltaTime
arguments.description: Time to fade the volume from previous to new value from.

name: CTakeDamageInfo
description:
A class used to store and modify all the data concerning a damage event.
An empty CTakeDamageInfo object can be created with <page>Global.DamageInfo</page>

List of hooks that this object is passed to:
* <page>ENTITY:OnTakeDamage</page>
* <page>GM:DoPlayerDeath</page>
* <page>GM:EntityTakeDamage</page>
* <page>GM:PostEntityTakeDamage</page>
* <page>GM:OnDamagedByExplosion</page>
* <page>GM:ScaleNPCDamage</page>
* <page>GM:ScalePlayerDamage</page>
* <page>NEXTBOT:OnInjured</page>
* <page>NEXTBOT:OnKilled</page>
* <page>NEXTBOT:OnOtherKilled</page>

List of functions that use this object:
* <page>util.BlastDamageInfo</page>
* <page>Entity:TakeDamageInfo</page>
* <page>Entity:TakePhysicsDamage</page>
* <page>Entity:DispatchTraceAttack</page>

functions.name: AddDamage
functions.description: Increases the damage by damageIncrease.

arguments.name: damageIncrease
arguments.description: The damage to add.

functions.name: GetBaseDamage
functions.description: Returns the initial unmodified by skill level ( <page>game.GetSkillLevel</page> ) damage.

returnValues.description: baseDamage

functions.name: IsExplosionDamage
functions.description: Returns whenever the damageinfo contains explosion damage.

returnValues.description: isExplDamage

functions.name: SetAmmoType
functions.description: Changes the ammo type used by the weapon that inflicted the damage.

arguments.name: ammoType
arguments.description: Ammo type ID

functions.name: SetBaseDamage
functions.description: Sets the initial unmodified by skill level ( <page>game.GetSkillLevel</page> ) damage. This function will not update or touch <page>CTakeDamageInfo:GetDamage</page>.

arguments.description: baseDamage

functions.name: SetDamageBonus
functions.description: Sets the bonus damage. Bonus damage isn't automatically applied, so this will have no outer effect by default.

arguments.name: damage
arguments.description: The extra damage to be added.

functions.name: SetDamageForce
functions.description:
Sets the directional force of the damage.
<note>
This function seems to have no effect on player knockback. To disable knockback entirely, see [EFL_NO_DAMAGE_FORCES](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Enums/EFL#EFL_NO_DAMAGE_FORCES) or use workaround example below.
</note>

arguments.name: force
arguments.description: The vector to set the force to.

functions.name: SetDamagePosition
functions.description: Sets the position of where the damage gets applied to.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The position where the damage will be applied.

functions.name: SetInflictor
functions.description:
Sets the inflictor of the damage for example a weapon.

For hitscan/bullet weapons this should the weapon.


For projectile ( rockets, etc ) weapons this should be the projectile.

arguments.name: inflictor
arguments.description: The new inflictor.

name: CUserCmd
description:
A class used to store the player inputs, such as mouse movement, view angles, <page>Enums/IN</page> buttons pressed and analog movement, the data from this class is then transfered to a <page>CMoveData</page> during actual movement simulation.

Can be modified during <page>GM:CreateMove</page>, <page>GM:StartCommand</page> and used in read only with <page>GM:SetupMove</page> and <page>Player:GetCurrentCommand</page>.

functions.name: ClearMovement
functions.description:
Clears the movement from the command.

See also <page>CUserCmd:SetForwardMove</page>, <page>CUserCmd:SetSideMove</page> and  <page>CUserCmd:SetUpMove</page>.

functions.name: GetButtons
functions.description: Returns a bitflag indicating which buttons are pressed.

returnValues.description: Pressed buttons, see <page>Enums/IN</page>

functions.name: GetMouseX
functions.description: Returns the delta of the angular horizontal mouse movement of the player.

returnValues.description: xDelta

functions.name: GetSideMove
functions.description: The speed the client wishes to move sideways with, positive if it wants to move right, negative if it wants to move left.

returnValues.description: requestSpeed

functions.name: GetUpMove
functions.description: The speed the client wishes to move up with, negative if the clients wants to move down.

returnValues.description: requestSpeed

functions.name: IsForced
functions.description:
When players are not sending usercommands to the server (often due to lag), their last usercommand will be executed multiple times as a backup. This function returns true if that is happening.

This will never return true clientside.

returnValues.description: isForced

functions.name: RemoveKey
functions.description:
Removes a key bit from the current key bitflag.

For movement you will want to use <page>CUserCmd:SetForwardMove</page>, <page>CUserCmd:SetUpMove</page> and <page>CUserCmd:SetSideMove</page>.

arguments.name: button
arguments.description: Bitflag to be removed from the key bitflag, see <page>Enums/IN</page>.

functions.name: SetMouseWheel
functions.description: Sets the scroll delta.

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: The scroll delta.

functions.name: SetMouseY
functions.description:
Sets the delta of the angular vertical mouse movement of the player.

See also <page>CUserCmd:SetMouseX</page>.

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: Angular vertical move delta.

functions.name: SetSideMove
functions.description:
Sets speed the client wishes to move sidewards with, positive to move right, negative to move left.

See also <page>CUserCmd:SetForwardMove</page> and  <page>CUserCmd:SetUpMove</page>.

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: The new speed to request.

functions.name: AddCallback
functions.description:
Add a callback function to a specific event. This is used instead of hooks to avoid calling empty functions unnecessarily.

This also allows you to use certain hooks in engine entities (non-scripted entities).

<warning>This method does not check if the function has already been added to this object before, so if you add the same callback twice, it will be run twice! Make sure to add your callback only once.</warning>

arguments.name: hook
arguments.description: The hook name to hook onto. See <page>Entity Callbacks</page>

arguments.name: func
arguments.description: The function to call

returnValues.description:
The callback ID that was just added, which can later be used in <page>Entity:RemoveCallback</page>.

Returns nothing if the passed callback function was invalid or when asking for a non-existent hook.

functions.name: AddSolidFlags
functions.description: Adds solid flag(s) to the entity.

arguments.name: flags
arguments.description: The flag(s) to apply, see <page>Enums/FSOLID</page>.

functions.name: AddToMotionController
functions.description:
Adds a <page>PhysObj</page>ect to the entity's motion controller so that <page>ENTITY:PhysicsSimulate</page> will be called for given <page>PhysObj</page>ect as well.

You must first create a motion controller with <page>Entity:StartMotionController</page>.

You can remove added <page>PhysObj</page>ects by using <page>Entity:RemoveFromMotionController</page>.

<note>Only works on a scripted <page>Entity</page> of anim type</note>

arguments.name: physObj
arguments.description: The <page>PhysObj</page> to add to the motion controller.

functions.name: BodyTarget
functions.description:
Returns a centered vector of this entity, NPCs use this internally to aim at their targets.

<note>This only works on players and NPCs.</note>

arguments.name: origin
arguments.description: The vector of where the the attack comes from.

arguments.name: noisy
arguments.description: Decides if it should return the centered vector with a random offset to it.

returnValues.description: The centered vector.

functions.name: ClearAllOutputs
functions.description: Clears all registered events for map I/O outputs on this entity. If a string is given, will use the string as a wildcard to limit removed outputs by name matches.

arguments.name: outputName
arguments.description: An optional string that will be used to limit removed outputs by name matches, supports wildcards.

functions.name: ClearPoseParameters
functions.description: Resets all pose parameters such as aim_yaw, aim_pitch and rotation.

functions.name: DestroyBoneFollowers
functions.description:
Destroys bone followers created by <page>Entity:CreateBoneFollowers</page>.

<note>This function only works on `anim` type entities.</note>

functions.name: DestroyShadow
functions.description:
Removes the shadow for the entity.

The shadow will be recreated as soon as the entity wakes.

<note>
Doesn't affect shadows from flashlight/lamps/env_projectedtexture.</note>

functions.name: DispatchTraceAttack
functions.description:
Performs a trace attack towards the entity this function is called on. Visually identical to <page>Entity:TakeDamageInfo</page>.

<warning>Calling this function on the victim entity in <page>ENTITY:OnTakeDamage</page> can cause infinite loops.</warning>

arguments.name: damageInfo
arguments.description: The damage to apply.

arguments.name: traceRes
arguments.description: Trace result to use to deal damage. See <page>Structures/TraceResult</page>

arguments.name: dir
arguments.description: Direction of the attack.

functions.name: Extinguish
functions.description:
Extinguishes the entity if it is on fire.

Has no effect if called inside <page>GM:EntityTakeDamage</page> (and the attacker is the flame that's hurting the entity)

See also <page>Entity:Ignite</page>.

functions.name: FollowBone
functions.description:
Makes an entity follow another entity's bone.

Internally this function calls <page>Entity:SetParent</page>( parent, boneid ), <page>Entity:AddEffects</page>( EF_FOLLOWBONE
) and sets an internal flag to always rebuild all bones.
<note>If the entity vibrates or stops following the parent, you probably need to run <page>Entity:SetPredictable</page>( true ) clientside.</note>
<warning>This function will not work if the target bone's parent bone is invalid or if the bone is not used by VERTEX LOD0</warning>

arguments.name: parent
arguments.description: The entity to follow the bone of. If unset, removes the FollowBone effect.

arguments.name: boneid
arguments.description: The bone to follow

functions.name: GetAnimTimeInterval
functions.description:
Returns the amount of time since last animation.

Works only on `CBaseAnimating` entities.

returnValues.description: The amount of time since last animation.

functions.name: GetBaseVelocity
functions.description: Returns the entity's base velocity which is their velocity due to forces applied by other entities. This includes entity-on-entity collision or riding a treadmill.

returnValues.description: The base velocity of the entity.

functions.name: GetBoneController
functions.description:
Returns the value of the bone controller with the specified ID.

<note>This is the precursor of pose parameters, and only works for Half Life 1: Source models supporting it.</note>

arguments.name: boneID
arguments.description: ID of the bone controller. Goes from 0 to 3.

returnValues.description: The value set on the bone controller.

functions.name: GetBoneCount
functions.description:
Returns the amount of bones in the entity.

<note>Will return `0` for <page>Global.ClientsideModel</page> or undrawn entities until <page>Entity:SetupBones</page> is called on the entity.</note>

returnValues.description: The amount of bones in given entity.

functions.name: GetBonePosition
functions.description:
Returns the position and angle of the given attachment, relative to the world.

<warning>This function can return entity's `GetPos()` instead if the entity doesn't have it's bone cache set up.

To ensure the bone position is correct use this:
```lua
local pos = ent:GetBonePosition(0)
if pos == ent:GetPos() then
pos = ent:GetBoneMatrix(0):GetTranslation()
end
```
</warning>

<note>This function returns the bone position from the last tick, so if your framerate is higher than the server's tickrate it may appear to lag behind if used on a fast moving entity. You can fix this by using the bone's matrix instead:
```lua
local matrix = entity:GetBoneMatrix(0)
local pos = matrix:GetTranslation()
local ang = matrix:GetAngles()
```
</note>

<bug issue="884">This can return the server's position during server lag.</bug>

<bug issue="3285">This can return garbage serverside or <page>Global.Vector</page>(0,0,0) for v49 models.</bug>

<bug issue="3739">This can return garbage if a trace passed through the target bone during bone matrix access.</bug>

arguments.name: boneIndex
arguments.description: The bone index of the bone to get the position of, starting at index 0. See <page>Entity:LookupBone</page>.

returnValues.description: The bone's position relative to the world. It can return nothing if the requested bone is out of bounds, or the entity has no model.
The bone's angle relative to the world.

functions.name: GetKeyValues
functions.description:
Returns a table containing all key values the entity has.

Single key values can usually be retrieved with <page>Entity:GetInternalVariable</page>.

<note>This only includes engine defined key values. For custom key values, use <page>GM:EntityKeyValue</page> or <page>ENTITY:KeyValue</page> to capture and store them.</note>

Here's a list of keyvalues that will not appear in this list, as they are not stored/defined as actual keyvalues internally:
* rendercolor - <page>Entity:GetColor</page> (Only RGB)
* rendercolor32 - <page>Entity:GetColor</page> (RGBA)
* renderamt - <page>Entity:GetColor</page> (Alpha)
* disableshadows - <page text="EF_NOSHADOW">Enums/EF#EF_NOSHADOW</page>
* mins - <page>Entity:GetCollisionBounds</page>
* maxs - <page>Entity:GetCollisionBounds</page>
* disablereceiveshadows - <page text="EF_NORECEIVESHADOW">Enums/EF#EF_NORECEIVESHADOW</page>
* nodamageforces - <page text="EFL_NO_DAMAGE_FORCES">Enums/EFL#EFL_NO_DAMAGE_FORCES</page>
* angle - <page>Entity:GetAngles</page>
* angles - <page>Entity:GetAngles</page>
* origin - <page>Entity:GetPos</page>
* targetname - <page>Entity:GetName</page>

returnValues.description: A table of key values.

functions.name: GetMomentaryRotButtonPos

functions.name: GetNWVarTable
functions.description: Returns all the networked variables in an entity.

returnValues.description: Key-Value table of all networked variables.

functions.name: GetParent
functions.description: Returns the parent entity of this entity.

returnValues.description: parentEntity

functions.name: GetParentPhysNum
functions.description: If the entity is parented to an entity that has a model with multiple physics objects (like a ragdoll), this is used to retrieve what physics object number the entity is parented to on it's parent.

returnValues.description: The physics object id, or nil if the entity has no parent

functions.name: GetPhysicsObject
functions.description:
Returns the entity's physics object, if the entity has physics.

<note>Entities don't have clientside physics objects by default, so this will return `[NULL PHYSOBJ]` on the client in most cases.</note>

returnValues.description: The entity's physics object.

functions.name: GetPos
functions.description: Gets the position of entity in world.

returnValues.description: The position of the entity.

functions.name: GetRagdollOwner
functions.description: Returns the entity which the ragdoll came from. The opposite of <page>Player:GetRagdollEntity</page>.

returnValues.description: The entity who owns the ragdoll.

functions.name: GetSaveTable
functions.description:
Returns a table of save values for an entity.

These tables are not the same between the client and the server, and different entities may have different fields.

You can get the list different fields an entity has by looking at it's source code (the 2013 SDK can be found [online](https://github.com/ValveSoftware/source-sdk-2013)). Accessible fields are defined by each `DEFINE_FIELD` and `DEFINE_KEYFIELD` inside the `DATADESC` block.

Take the headcrab, for example:

```
BEGIN_DATADESC( CBaseHeadcrab )
// m_nGibCount - don't save
DEFINE_FIELD( m_bHidden, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_flTimeDrown, FIELD_TIME ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_bCommittedToJump, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_vecCommittedJumpPos, FIELD_POSITION_VECTOR ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_flNextNPCThink, FIELD_TIME ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_flIgnoreWorldCollisionTime, FIELD_TIME ),

DEFINE_KEYFIELD( m_bStartBurrowed, FIELD_BOOLEAN, "startburrowed" ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_bBurrowed, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_flBurrowTime, FIELD_TIME ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_nContext, FIELD_INTEGER ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_bCrawlFromCanister, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_bMidJump, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_nJumpFromCanisterDir, FIELD_INTEGER ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_bHangingFromCeiling, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_flIlluminatedTime, FIELD_TIME ),

DEFINE_INPUTFUNC( FIELD_VOID, "Burrow", InputBurrow ),
DEFINE_INPUTFUNC( FIELD_VOID, "BurrowImmediate", InputBurrowImmediate ),
DEFINE_INPUTFUNC( FIELD_VOID, "Unburrow", InputUnburrow ),
DEFINE_INPUTFUNC( FIELD_VOID, "StartHangingFromCeiling", InputStartHangingFromCeiling ),
DEFINE_INPUTFUNC( FIELD_VOID, "DropFromCeiling", InputDropFromCeiling ),

// Function Pointers
DEFINE_THINKFUNC( EliminateRollAndPitch ),
DEFINE_THINKFUNC( ThrowThink ),
DEFINE_ENTITYFUNC( LeapTouch ),
END_DATADESC()
```

* For each **DEFINE_FIELD**, the save table will have a key with name of **first** argument.
* For each **DEFINE_KEYFIELD**, the save table will have a key with name of the **third** argument.

See <page>Entity:GetInternalVariable</page> for only retrieving one key of the save table.

arguments.name: showAll
arguments.description: If set, shows all variables, not just the ones for save.

returnValues.description:
A table containing all save values in key/value format.

The value may be a sequential table (starting to **1**) if the field in question is an array in engine.

functions.name: GetSequenceMoveDist
functions.description:
Returns an entity's sequence move distance (the change in position over the course of the entire sequence).

See <page>Entity:GetSequenceMovement</page> for a similar function with more options.

arguments.name: sequenceId
arguments.description: The sequence index.

returnValues.description: The move distance of the sequence.

functions.name: GetSequenceName
functions.description:
Return the name of the sequence for the index provided.
Refer to <page>Entity:GetSequence</page> to find the current active sequence on this entity.

See <page>Entity:LookupSequence</page> for a function that does the opposite.

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: The index of the sequence to look up.

returnValues.description: Name of the sequence.

functions.name: GetShouldPlayPickupSound
functions.description: Checks if the entity plays a sound when picked up by a player.

returnValues.description: `true` if it plays the pickup sound, `false` otherwise.

functions.name: GetTable
functions.description: Returns the table that contains all script values saved within the entity.

returnValues.description: The entity's Lua table.

functions.name: GibBreakClient
functions.description:
Causes the entity to break into its current models gibs, if it has any.

You must call <page>Entity:PrecacheGibs</page> on the entity before using this function, or it will not create any gibs.

If called on server, the gibs will be spawned on the currently connected clients and will not be synchronized. Otherwise the gibs will be spawned only for the client the function is called on.

<note>
this function will not remove or hide the entity it is called on.
For more expensive version of this function see <page>Entity:GibBreakServer</page>.
</note>

arguments.name: force
arguments.description: The force to apply to the created gibs.

arguments.name: clr
arguments.description: If set, this will be color of the broken gibs instead of the entity's color.

functions.name: GibBreakServer
functions.description:
Causes the entity to break into its current models gibs, if it has any.

You must call <page>Entity:PrecacheGibs</page> on the entity before using this function, or it will not create any gibs.

The gibs will be spawned on the server and be synchronized with all clients.

Note, that this function will not remove or hide the entity it is called on.

This function is affected by `props_break_max_pieces_perframe` and `props_break_max_pieces` console variables.

<warning>Large numbers of serverside gibs will cause lag.

You can avoid this cost by spawning the gibs on the client using <page>Entity:GibBreakClient</page></warning>

<note>Despite existing on client, it doesn't actually do anything on client.</note>

arguments.name: force
arguments.description: The force to apply to the created gibs

functions.name: HasSpawnFlags
functions.description: Returns whether this entity has the specified spawnflags bits set.

arguments.name: spawnFlags
arguments.description: The spawnflag bits to check, see <page>Enums/SF</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether the entity has that spawnflag set or not.

functions.name: Ignite
functions.description:
Sets the entity on fire.

See also <page>Entity:Extinguish</page>.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: How long to keep the entity ignited, in seconds.

arguments.name: radius
arguments.description: The radius of the ignition, will ignite everything around the entity that is in this radius.

functions.name: IsConstraint
functions.description: Returns if entity is constraint or not

returnValues.description: Is the entity a constraint or not

functions.name: IsOnGround
functions.description:
Returns whether the entity is on ground or not.

Internally, this checks if <page text="FL_ONGROUND">Enums/FL</page> is set on the entity.

This function is an alias of <page>Entity:OnGround</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether the entity is on ground or not.

functions.name: IsPointInBounds
functions.description:
Returns whether a given point is within the entity's Orientated Bounding Box.

This relies on the entity having a collision mesh (not a physics object) and will be affected by `SOLID_NONE`.

arguments.name: point
arguments.description: The point to test, in world space coordinates.

returnValues.description: Whether the point is within the entity's bounds.

functions.name: IsSolid
functions.description:
Returns if the entity is solid or not.
Very useful for determining if the entity is a trigger or not.

returnValues.description: Whether the entity is solid or not.

functions.name: IsValid
functions.description:
Returns whether the entity is a valid entity or not.

An entity is valid if:
* It is not a <page text="NULL">Global_Variables</page> entity
* It is not the worldspawn entity (<page>game.GetWorld</page>)

<note>Instead of calling this method directly, it's a good idea to call the global <page>Global.IsValid</page> instead, however if you're sure the variable you're using is always an entity object it's better to use this method</note>

It will check whether the given variable contains an object (an Entity) or nothing at all for you. See examples.

<warning>NULL entities can still be assigned with key/value pairs, but they will be instantly negated. See example 3</warning>
This might be a cause for a lot of headache. Usually happening during networking etc., when completely valid entities suddenly become invalid on the client, but are never filtered with IsValid(). See <page>GM:InitPostEntity</page> for more details.

returnValues.description: true if the entity is valid, false otherwise

functions.name: MakePhysicsObjectAShadow
functions.description:
Turns the <page>Entity:GetPhysicsObject</page> into a physics shadow.
It's used internally for the Player's and NPC's physics object, and certain HL2 entities such as the crane.

A physics shadow can be used to have static entities that never move by setting both arguments to false.

<note>Unlike <page>Entity:PhysicsInitShadow</page>, this function doesn't remove the current physics object.</note>

arguments.name: allowPhysicsMovement
arguments.description: Whether to allow the physics shadow to move under stress.

arguments.name: allowPhysicsRotation
arguments.description: Whether to allow the physics shadow to rotate under stress.

functions.name: MarkShadowAsDirty
functions.description: Refreshes the shadow of the entity.

functions.name: NearestPoint
functions.description:
Performs a Ray-Orientated Bounding Box intersection from the given position to the origin of the OBBox with the entity and returns the hit position on the OBBox.

This relies on the entity having a collision mesh (not a physics object) and will be affected by `SOLID_NONE`

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: The vector to start the intersection from.

returnValues.description: The nearest hit point of the entity's bounding box in world coordinates.

functions.name: NetworkVarNotify
functions.description:
Creates a callback that will execute when the given network variable changes - that is, when the `Set<name>()` function is run.

<note>The callback is executed **before** the value is changed, and is called even if the new and old values are the same.

This function does not exist on entities in which <page>Entity:InstallDataTable</page> has not been called. By default, this means this function only exists on SENTs (both serverside and clientside) and on players with a <page text="Player Class">Player_Classes</page> (serverside and clientside <page>Global.LocalPlayer</page> only). It's therefore safest to only use this in <page>ENTITY:SetupDataTables</page>.</note>

<bug request="324">The callback will not be called clientside if the var is changed right after entity spawn.</bug>
</name>

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of variable to track changes of.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description:
The function to call when the variable changes. It is passed 4 arguments:
* <page>Entity</page> entity - Entity whos variable changed.
* <page>string</page> name - Name of changed variable.
* <page>any</page> old - Old/current variable value.
* <page>any</page> new - New variable value that it was set to.

functions.name: OBBCenter
functions.description: Returns the center of an entity's bounding box in local space.

returnValues.description: The center of an entity's bounding box relative to its <page>Entity:GetPos</page>.

functions.name: PassesDamageFilter
functions.description:
Tests whether the damage passes the entity filter.

This will call <page>ENTITY:PassesDamageFilter</page> on scripted entities of the type "filter".

<note>This function only works on entities of the type "filter". ( filter_* entities, including base game filter entites )</note>

arguments.name: dmg
arguments.description: The damage info to test

returnValues.description: Whether the damage info passes the entity filter.

functions.name: PhysicsDestroy
functions.description:
Destroys the current physics object of an entity.

<note>Cannot be used on a ragdoll or the world entity.</note>

functions.name: PhysicsInitSphere
functions.description:
Makes the physics object of the entity a sphere.

This function will automatically destroy any previous physics objects and do the following:
* <page>Entity:SetSolid</page>( `SOLID_BBOX` )
* <page>Entity:SetMoveType</page>( `MOVETYPE_VPHYSICS` )

<bug issue="5060">Clientside physics objects are broken and do not move properly in some cases. Physics objects should only created on the server or you will experience incorrect physgun beam position, prediction issues, and other unexpected behavior.

A workaround is available on the <page>Entity:PhysicsInitConvex</page> page.</bug>

arguments.name: radius
arguments.description: The radius of the sphere.

arguments.name: physmat
arguments.description: Physical material from [surfaceproperties.txt](https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod/blob/master/garrysmod/scripts/surfaceproperties.txt) or added with <page>physenv.AddSurfaceData</page>.

returnValues.description: Returns `true` on success, `false` otherwise

functions.name: RagdollStopControlling
functions.description: Sets the function to build the ragdoll. This is used alongside Kinect in <page>Entity:SetRagdollBuildFunction</page>, for more info see ragdoll_motion entity.

functions.name: RemoveInternalConstraint
functions.description:
Breaks internal Ragdoll constrains, so you can for example separate an arm from the body of a ragdoll and preserve all physics.

The visual mesh will still stretch as if it was properly connected unless the ragdoll model is specifically designed to avoid that.

arguments.name: num
arguments.description: Which constraint to break, values below 0 mean break them all

functions.name: ResetSequence
functions.description:
Plays an animation on the entity. This may not always work on engine entities.

<warning>This will not reset the animation on viewmodels, use <page>Entity:SendViewModelMatchingSequence</page> instead.</warning>

<note>This will not work properly if called directly after calling <page>Entity:SetModel</page>. Consider waiting until the next Tick.

Will not work on players due to the animations being reset every frame by the base gamemode animation system. See <page>GM:CalcMainActivity</page>.

For custom scripted entities you will want to apply example from <page>ENTITY:Think</page> to make animations work.</note>

arguments.name: sequence
arguments.description:
The sequence to play. Also accepts strings.

<note>If set to a string, the function will automatically call <page>Entity:LookupSequence</page> to retrieve the sequence ID as a number.</note>

functions.name: SetAnimation
functions.description: Sets a player's third-person animation. Mainly used by <page>Weapon</page>s to start the player's weapon attack and reload animations.

arguments.name: playerAnim
arguments.description: Player animation, see <page>Enums/PLAYER</page>.

functions.name: SetBodygroup
functions.description:
Sets an entities' bodygroup.
<note>If called for Weapon (after Initialize hook) with different body groups on world model and view model, check will occur by view model.</note>

arguments.name: bodygroup
arguments.description: The id of the bodygroup you're setting. Starts from 0.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value you're setting the bodygroup to. Starts from 0.

functions.name: SetCollisionBounds
functions.description:
Sets the collision bounds for the entity, which are used for triggers (<page>Entity:SetTrigger</page>, <page>ENTITY:Touch</page>), and collision (If <page>Entity:SetSolid</page> set as <page text="SOLID_BBOX">Enums/SOLID</page>).

Input bounds are relative to <page>Entity:GetPos</page>!
See also <page>Entity:SetCollisionBoundsWS</page>.

<note>Player collision bounds are reset every frame to player's <page>Player:SetHull</page> values.</note>

arguments.name: mins
arguments.description: The minimum vector of the bounds.

arguments.name: maxs
arguments.description: The maximum vector of the bounds.

functions.name: SetCollisionBoundsWS
functions.description: A convenience function that sets the collision bounds for the entity in world space coordinates by transforming given vectors to entity's local space and passing them to <page>Entity:SetCollisionBounds</page>

arguments.name: vec1
arguments.description: The first vector of the bounds.

arguments.name: vec2
arguments.description: The second vector of the bounds.

functions.name: SetCollisionGroup
functions.description: Sets the entity's collision group.

arguments.name: group
arguments.description: Collision group of the entity, see <page>Enums/COLLISION_GROUP</page>

functions.name: SetEyeTarget
functions.description: Sets the position an entity's eyes look toward. This works as an override for default behavior. Set to `0,0,0` to disable the override.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: If NPC, the **world position** for the entity to look towards, for Ragdolls, a **local position** in front of their `eyes` attachment.

functions.name: SetGravity
functions.description:
Sets the gravity multiplier of the entity.

<bug issue="3648">This function is not predicted.</bug>
<note>This only works on players</note>

arguments.name: gravityMultiplier
arguments.description: Value which specifies the gravity multiplier.

functions.name: SetHitboxSet
functions.description: Sets the current Hitbox set for the entity.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description:
The new hitbox set to set. Can be a name as a <page>string</page>, or the ID as a <page>number</page>.

If the operation failed, the function will silently fail.

functions.name: SetKeyValue
functions.description:
Sets Hammer key values on an entity.

You can look up which entities have what key values on the [Valve Developer Community](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/) on entity pages.


A  list of basic entities can be found [here](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/List_of_entities).

Alternatively you can look at the .fgd files shipped with Garry's Mod in the bin/ folder with a text editor to see the key values as they appear in Hammer.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The internal key name

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to set

functions.name: SetLayerCycle
functions.description:
Sets the animation cycle/frame of given layer.

<note>This function only works on <page>BaseAnimatingOverlay</page> entities.</note>

arguments.name: layerID
arguments.description: The Layer ID

arguments.name: cycle
arguments.description: The new animation cycle/frame for given layer.

functions.name: SetLayerPlaybackRate
functions.description:
Sets the layer playback rate. See also <page>Entity:SetLayerDuration</page>.

<note>This function only works on <page>BaseAnimatingOverlay</page> entities.</note>

arguments.name: layerID
arguments.description: The Layer ID

arguments.name: rate
arguments.description: The new playback rate.

functions.name: SetMaxHealth
functions.description: Sets the maximum health for entity. Note, that you can still set entity's health above this amount with <page>Entity:SetHealth</page>.

arguments.name: maxhealth
arguments.description: What the max health should be

functions.name: SetModel
functions.description:
Sets the model of the entity.

This does not update the physics of the entity - see <page>Entity:PhysicsInit</page>.

<warning>This silently fails when given an empty string.</warning>

arguments.name: modelName
arguments.description: New model value.

functions.name: SetModelName
functions.description: Alter the model name returned by <page>Entity:GetModel</page>. Does not affect the entity's actual model.

arguments.name: modelname
arguments.description: The new model name.

functions.name: SetName
functions.description: Sets the mapping name of the entity.

arguments.name: mappingName
arguments.description: The name to set for the entity.

functions.name: SetNetworkAngles
functions.description: Alters the entity's perceived serverside angle on the client.

arguments.name: angle
arguments.description: Networked angle.

functions.name: SetNetworked2Int
functions.description:
Sets a networked integer (whole number) value on the entity.

The value can then be accessed with <page>Entity:GetNetworked2Int</page> both from client and server.

See <page>Entity:SetNW2Float</page> for numbers that aren't integers.
<deprecated>You should be using <page>Entity:SetNW2Int</page> instead.</deprecated>
<warning>The value will only be updated clientside if the entity is or enters the clients PVS.
The integer has a 32 bit limit. Use <page>Entity:SetNWInt</page> instead</warning>

functions.name: SetOwner
functions.description:
Sets the owner of this entity, disabling all physics interaction with it.

<note>This function is generally used to disable physics interactions on projectiles being fired by their owner, but can also be used for normal ownership in case physics interactions are not involved at all. The Gravity gun will be able to pick up the entity even if the owner can't collide with it, the Physics gun however will not.</note>

arguments.name: owner
arguments.description: The entity to be set as owner.

functions.name: SetParentPhysNum
functions.description:
Sets the parent of an entity to another entity with the given physics bone number. Similar to <page>Entity:SetParent</page>, except it is parented to a physbone. This function is useful mainly for ragdolls.

<note>Despite this function being available server side, it doesn't actually do anything server side.</note>

arguments.name: bone
arguments.description: Physics bone number to attach to. Use 0 for objects with only one physics bone. (See <page>Entity:GetPhysicsObjectNum</page>)

functions.name: SetPredictable
functions.description:
Sets whether an entity should be predictable or not.
When an entity is set as predictable, its DT vars can be changed during predicted hooks. This is useful for entities which can be controlled by player input.

Any datatable value that mismatches from the server will be overridden and a prediction error will be spewed.

Weapons are predictable by default, and the drive system uses this function to make the controlled prop predictable as well.

Visit  for a list of all predicted hooks, and the <page>Prediction</page> page.
For further technical information on the subject, visit [valve's wiki](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Prediction).

<note>This function resets the datatable variables everytime it's called, it should ideally be called when a player starts using the entity and when he stops</note>
<note>Entities set as predictable with this function will be unmarked when the user lags and receives a full packet update, to handle such case visit <page>GM:NotifyShouldTransmit</page></note>

arguments.name: setPredictable
arguments.description: whether to make this entity predictable or not.

functions.name: SetRenderOrigin
functions.description: Set the render origin override, a position where the Entity will be rendered at.

arguments.name: newOrigin
arguments.description: The new origin in world coordinates where the Entity's model will now be rendered at. To disable the override, set to <page>nil</page>.

functions.name: SetSequence
functions.description:
Sets the entity's model sequence.

If the specified sequence is already active, the animation will not be restarted. See <page>Entity:ResetSequence</page> for a function that restarts the animation even if it is already playing.

In some cases you want to run <page>Entity:ResetSequenceInfo</page> to make this function run.

<note>This will not work properly if called directly after calling <page>Entity:SetModel</page>. Consider waiting until the next Tick.

Will not work on players due to the animations being reset every frame by the base gamemode animation system. See <page>GM:CalcMainActivity</page>.

For custom scripted entities you will want to apply example from <page>ENTITY:Think</page> to make animations work.</note>

arguments.name: sequenceId
arguments.description:
The sequence to play. Also accepts strings.

<note>If set to a string, the function will automatically call <page>Entity:LookupSequence</page> to retrieve the sequence ID as a number.</note>

functions.name: SetSkin
functions.description: Sets the skin of the entity.

arguments.name: skinIndex
arguments.description: 0-based index of the skin to use.

functions.name: SetTransmitWithParent
functions.description:
When this flag is set the entity will only transmit to the player when its parent is transmitted. This is useful for things like viewmodel attachments since without this flag they will transmit to everyone (and cause the viewmodels to transmit to everyone too).

<note>In the case of scripted entities, this will override <page>ENTITY:UpdateTransmitState</page></note>

arguments.name: onoff
arguments.description: Will set the TransmitWithParent flag on or off

functions.name: SetUnFreezable
functions.description: Sets whether an entity can be unfrozen, meaning that it cannot be unfrozen using the physgun.

arguments.name: freezable
arguments.description: True to make the entity unfreezable, false otherwise.

functions.name: SetupBones
functions.description:
Forces the entity to reconfigure its bones. You might need to call this after changing your model's scales or when manually drawing the entity multiple times at different positions.

<note>This calls the BuildBonePositions callback added via <page>Entity:AddCallback</page>, so avoid calling this function inside it to prevent an infinite loop.</note>

functions.name: SetupPhonemeMappings
functions.description:
Initializes the class names of an entity's phoneme mappings (mouth movement data). This is called by default with argument "phonemes" when a flex-based entity (such as an <page>NPC</page>) is created.

<note>TF2 phonemes can be accessed by using a path such as "player/scout/phonemes/phonemes" , check TF2's "tf2_misc_dir.vpk" with GCFScape for other paths, however it seems that TF2 sounds don't contain phoneme definitions anymore after being converted to mp3 and only rely on VCD animations, this needs to be further investigated</note>

arguments.name: fileRoot
arguments.description: The file prefix of the phoneme mappings (relative to "garrysmod/expressions/").

functions.name: SetVar
functions.description:
Allows to quickly set variable to entity's <page>Entity:GetTable</page>.

<note>This will not network the variable to client(s). You want <page>Entity:SetNWString</page> and similar functions for that</note>

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: Key of the value to set

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Value to set the variable to

functions.name: SetWeaponModel
functions.description:
Sets the model and associated weapon to this viewmodel entity.

This is used internally when the player switches weapon.

<note>View models are not drawn without a weapons associated to them.</note>
<warning>This will silently fail if the entity is not a viewmodel.</warning>

arguments.name: viewModel
arguments.description:
The model string to give to this viewmodel.
Example: "models/weapons/c_smg1.mdl"

arguments.name: weapon
arguments.description: The weapon entity to associate this viewmodel to.

functions.name: StartLoopingSound
functions.description:
Starts a "looping" sound. As with any other sound playing methods, this function expects the sound file to be looping itself and will not automatically loop a non looping sound file as one might expect.

This function is almost identical to <page>Global.CreateSound</page>, with the exception of the sound being created in the STATIC channel and with normal attenuation.

See also <page>Entity:StopLoopingSound</page>

arguments.name: sound
arguments.description: Sound to play. Can be either a sound script or a filepath.

returnValues.description: The ID number of started sound starting with 0, or -1 if we failed for some reason.

functions.name: StopParticles
functions.description:
Stops any attached to the entity .pcf particles using <page>Global.ParticleEffectAttach</page> or <page>Global.ParticleEffect</page>.

On client, this is the same as <page>Entity:StopParticleEmission</page>. ( and you should use StopParticleEmission instead )


On server, this is the same as running <page>Entity:StopParticleEmission</page> on every client.

functions.name: TranslateBoneToPhysBone
functions.description:
Returns the ID of a <page>PhysObj</page> attached to the given bone. To be used with <page>Entity:GetPhysicsObjectNum</page>.

See <page>Entity:TranslatePhysBoneToBone</page> for reverse function.

arguments.name: boneID
arguments.description: The ID of a bone to look up the "physics root" bone of.

returnValues.description:
The <page>PhysObj</page> ID of the given bone.

* -1 if we somehow cannot translate

functions.name: WorldSpaceAABB
functions.description: Returns two vectors representing the minimum and maximum extent of the entity's axis-aligned bounding box (which is calculated from entity's collision bounds.

returnValues.description: The minimum vector for the entity's bounding box in world space.
The maximum vector for the entity's bounding box in world space.

functions.name: WorldToLocalAngles
functions.description: Converts world angles to local angles ( local to the entity )

arguments.name: ang
arguments.description: The world angles

returnValues.description: The local angles

functions.name: ReadULong
functions.description: Reads an unsigned little-endian 32-bit integer from the file.

returnValues.description: An unsigned 32-bit integer

functions.name: WriteFloat
functions.description: Writes an IEEE 754 little-endian 4-byte float to the file.

arguments.name: float
arguments.description: The float to be written to the file.

name: IGModAudioChannel
description: A sound channel returned by a callback of <page>sound.PlayURL</page> and <page>sound.PlayFile</page>.

functions.name: GetBufferedTime
functions.description:
Returns the buffered time of the sound channel in seconds, for online streaming sound channels. (<page>sound.PlayURL</page>)

For offline channels this will be equivalent to <page>IGModAudioChannel:GetLength</page>.

returnValues.description: The current buffered time of the stream, in seconds.

functions.name: Is3D
functions.description: Returns if the sound channel is in 3D mode or not.

returnValues.description: Is 3D or not.

functions.name: IsLooping
functions.description: Returns if the sound channel is looping or not.

returnValues.description: Is looping or not.

functions.name: IsOnline
functions.description: Returns if the sound channel is streamed from the Internet or not.

returnValues.description: Is online or not.

functions.name: Set3DCone
functions.description: Sets 3D cone of the sound channel.

arguments.name: innerAngle
arguments.description:
The angle of the inside projection cone in degrees.




Range is from 0 (no cone) to 360 (sphere), -1 = leave current.

arguments.name: outerAngle
arguments.description:
The angle of the outside projection cone in degrees.




Range is from 0 (no cone) to 360 (sphere), -1 = leave current.

arguments.name: outerVolume
arguments.description:
The delta-volume outside the outer projection cone.




Range is from 0 (silent) to 1 (same as inside the cone), less than 0 = leave current.

functions.name: Set3DFadeDistance
functions.description: Sets 3D fade distances of a sound channel.

arguments.name: min
arguments.description:
The minimum distance. The channel's volume is at maximum when the listener is within this distance.




0 or less = leave current.

arguments.name: max
arguments.description:
The maximum distance. The channel's volume stops decreasing when the listener is beyond this distance.




0 or less = leave current.

functions.name: SetPan
functions.description: Sets the relative volume of the left and right channels.

arguments.name: pan
arguments.description: Relative volume between the left and right channels. -1 means only in left channel, 0 is center and 1 is only in the right channel.

functions.name: SetPos
functions.description: Sets position of sound channel in case the sound channel has a 3d option set.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The position to put the sound into

arguments.name: dir
arguments.description: The direction of the sound

functions.name: SetVolume
functions.description: Sets the volume of a sound channel

arguments.name: volume
arguments.description: Volume to set. 1 meaning 100% volume, 0.5 is 50% and 3 is 300%, etc.

functions.name: Stop
functions.description:
Stop the stream. It can be started again using <page>IGModAudioChannel:Play</page>.

<bug issue="1497">Calling this invalidates the IGModAudioChannel object rendering it unusable for further functions.</bug>

functions.name: GetKeyValues
functions.description: Gets all the key values defined for the material.

returnValues.description: The material's key values.

functions.name: GetString
functions.description: Returns the specified material string, or nil if the value is not set or if the value can not be converted to a string.

arguments.name: materialString
arguments.description: The name of the material string.

returnValues.description: The value as a string

functions.name: GetVector
functions.description:
Returns the specified material vector, or nil if the value is not set.

See also <page>IMaterial:GetVectorLinear</page>

arguments.name: materialVector
arguments.description: The name of the material vector.

returnValues.description: The color vector

functions.name: IsError
functions.description: Returns whenever the material is valid, i.e. whether it was not loaded successfully from disk or not.

returnValues.description: Is this material the error material? (___error)

functions.name: SetInt
functions.description:
Sets the specified material value to the specified int, does nothing on a type mismatch.

<note>Please note that certain material flags such as `$model` are stored in the `$flags` variable and cannot be directly set with this function. See the full list here: <page>Material Flags</page></note>

arguments.name: materialInt
arguments.description: The name of the material int.

arguments.name: int
arguments.description: The new int value.

functions.name: IsValid
functions.description: Returns whether this <page>IMesh</page> is valid or not.

returnValues.description: Whether this <page>IMesh</page> is valid or not.

name: IRestore
description:
The object used in the <page>saverestore</page>, mainly in <page>saverestore.AddRestoreHook</page>.

It allows you to read blocks directly from the save game files used by Half-Life 2 save system when such save is loaded.

functions.name: ReadEntity
functions.description: Reads next bytes from the restore object as an <page>Entity</page>.

returnValues.description: The entity that has been read.

functions.name: ReadString
functions.description: Reads next bytes from the restore object as a <page>string</page>.

returnValues.description: The read string.

functions.name: WriteString
functions.description: Writes a **null terminated** <page>string</page> to the save object.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: The string to write.

functions.name: GetMaxWidth
functions.description: Gets maximum width for this markup object as defined in <page>markup.Parse</page>.

returnValues.name: maxWidth
returnValues.description: The max width.

functions.name: FindSpot
functions.description: Like <page>NextBot:FindSpots</page> but only returns a vector.

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: Either `"random"`, `"near"`, `"far"`.

arguments.name: options
arguments.description:
This table should contain the search info.
* <page>string</page> type - The type (Only `hiding` for now)
* <page>Vector</page> pos - the position to search.
* <page>number</page> radius - the radius to search.
* <page>number</page> stepup - the highest step to step up.
* <page>number</page> stepdown - the highest we can step down without being hurt.

returnValues.description: If it finds a spot it will return a vector. If not it will return nil.

functions.name: FindSpots
functions.description: Returns a table of hiding spots.

arguments.name: specs
arguments.description:
This table should contain the search info.
* <page>string</page> type - The type (optional, only `hiding` supported)
* <page>Vector</page> pos - the position to search.
* <page>number</page> radius - the radius to search.
* <page>number</page> stepup - the highest step to step up.
* <page>number</page> stepdown - the highest we can step down without being hurt.

returnValues.description:
An unsorted table of tables containing:
* <page>Vector</page> vector - The position of the hiding spot
* <page>number</page> distance - the distance to that position

functions.name: GetRangeSquaredTo
functions.description:
Returns squared distance to an entity or a position.

See also <page>NextBot:GetRangeTo</page>.

arguments.name: to
arguments.description: The position to measure distance to. Can be an entity.

returnValues.description: The squared distance

functions.name: CapabilitiesGet
functions.description: Returns the NPC's capabilities along the ones defined on its weapon.

returnValues.description:
The capabilities as a bitflag.
See <page>Enums/CAP</page>

functions.name: CapabilitiesRemove
functions.description: Remove a certain capability.

arguments.name: capabilities
arguments.description: Capabilities to remove, see <page>Enums/CAP</page>

functions.name: ClearBlockingEntity
functions.description: Resets the <page>NPC:GetBlockingEntity</page>.

functions.name: ClearCondition
functions.description: Clears out the specified <page>Enums/COND</page> on this NPC.

arguments.name: condition
arguments.description: The <page>Enums/COND</page> to clear out.

functions.name: DropWeapon
functions.description: Forces the NPC to drop the specified weapon.

arguments.name: weapon
arguments.description: Weapon to be dropped. If unset, will default to the currently equipped weapon.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: If set, launches the weapon at given position. There is a limit to how far it is willing to throw the weapon. Overrides velocity argument.

arguments.name: velocity
arguments.description: If set and previous argument is unset, launches the weapon with given velocity. If the velocity is higher than 400, it will be clamped to 400.

functions.name: GetActivity
functions.description: Returns the NPC's current activity.

returnValues.description: Current activity, see <page>Enums/ACT</page>.

functions.name: GetArrivalActivity
functions.description: Returns the activity to be played when the NPC arrives at its goal

returnValues.description: The arrival activity. See <page>Enums/ACT</page>.

functions.name: GetBlockingEntity
functions.description: Returns the entity blocking the NPC along its path.

returnValues.description: Blocking entity

functions.name: GetCurrentSchedule
functions.description: Returns the NPC's current schedule.

returnValues.description: The NPCs schedule, see <page>Enums/SCHED</page> or -1 if we failed for some reason

functions.name: GetEnemy
functions.description:
Returns the entity that this NPC is trying to fight.

<bug issue="3132">This returns nil if the NPC has no enemy. You should use <page>Global.IsValid</page> (which accounts for nil and NULL) on the return to verify validity of the enemy.</bug>

returnValues.description: Enemy NPC.

functions.name: GetEnemyLastSeenPos
functions.description:
Returns the last seen position of an NPC's enemy.

Similar to <page>NPC:GetEnemyLastKnownPos</page>, but the known position will be a few seconds ahead of the last seen position.

arguments.name: enemy
arguments.description: The enemy to check.

returnValues.name: pos
returnValues.description: The last seen position.

functions.name: GetMinMoveCheckDist
functions.description: Returns how far should the NPC look ahead in its route.

returnValues.description: How far the NPC checks ahead of its route.

functions.name: GetMinMoveStopDist
functions.description: Returns how far before the NPC can come to a complete stop.

arguments.name: minResult
arguments.description: The minimum value that will be returned by this function.

returnValues.description: The minimum stop distance.

functions.name: GetMoveInterval
functions.description: Returns the current timestep the internal NPC motor is working on.

returnValues.description: The current timestep.

functions.name: GetMovementSequence
functions.description: Returns the index of the sequence the NPC uses to move.

returnValues.description: The movement sequence index

functions.name: GetNPCState
functions.description: Returns the NPC's state.

returnValues.description: The NPC's current state, see <page>Enums/NPC_STATE</page>.

functions.name: GetTaskStatus
functions.description: Returns the status of the current task.

returnValues.description: The status. See <page>Enums/TASKSTATUS</page>.

functions.name: GetWeapon
functions.description: Returns a specific weapon the NPC owns.

arguments.name: class
arguments.description: A classname of the weapon to try to get.

returnValues.name: wep
returnValues.description: The weapon for the specified class, or NULL of the NPC doesn't have given weapon.

functions.name: HasCondition
functions.description: Returns whether or not the NPC has the given condition.

arguments.name: condition
arguments.description: The condition index, see <page>Enums/COND</page>.

returnValues.description: True if the NPC has the given condition, false otherwise.

functions.name: HasEnemyEluded
functions.description: Polls the enemy memory to check if the given entity has eluded us or not.

arguments.name: enemy
arguments.description: The enemy to test.

returnValues.name: eluded
returnValues.description: If the enemy has eluded us.

functions.name: IgnoreEnemyUntil
functions.description: Makes the NPC ignore given entity/enemy until given time.

arguments.name: enemy
arguments.description: The enemy to ignore.

arguments.name: until
arguments.description: How long to ignore the enemy for. This will be compared to <page>Global.CurTime</page>, so your value should be based on it.

functions.name: IsCurrentSchedule
functions.description: Returns whether or not the NPC is performing the given schedule.

arguments.name: schedule
arguments.description: The schedule number, see <page>Enums/SCHED</page>.

returnValues.description: True if the NPC is performing the given schedule, false otherwise.

functions.name: IsCurWaypointGoal
functions.description: Returns whether the current navigational waypoint is the final one.

returnValues.description: Whether the current navigational waypoint is the final one.

functions.name: IsFacingIdealYaw
functions.description: Returns whether the NPC is facing their ideal yaw. See <page>NPC:SetIdealYaw</page>, <page>NPC:GetIdealYaw</page> and <page>NPC:SetIdealYawAndUpdate</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether the NPC is facing their ideal yaw.

functions.name: MoveOrder
functions.description:
Makes the NPC walk toward the given position. The NPC will return to the player after amount of time set by **player_squad_autosummon_time** <page>ConVar</page>.

Only works on Citizens (npc_citizen) and is a part of the Half-Life 2 squad system.

The NPC **must** be in the player's squad for this to work.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: The target position for the NPC to walk to.

functions.name: MoveStart
functions.description:
Starts NPC movement?

Related functions are <page>NPC:MoveStop</page>, <page>NPC:MovePause</page> and <page>NPC:ResetMoveCalc</page>.

functions.name: PickupWeapon
functions.description: Forces the NPC to pickup an existing weapon entity. The NPC will not pick up the weapon if they already own a weapon of given type, or if the NPC could not normally have this weapon in their inventory.

arguments.name: wep
arguments.description: The weapon to try to pick up.

returnValues.name: result
returnValues.description: Whether the NPC succeeded in picking up the weapon or not.

functions.name: PlaySentence

arguments.description: The sentence string to speak.

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: Delay in seconds until the sentence starts playing.

arguments.name: volume
arguments.description: The volume of the sentence, from 0 to 1.

returnValues.description: Returns the sentence index, -1 if the sentence couldn't be played.

arguments.name: taskData
arguments.description: The task data.

functions.name: SentenceStop

Stops any sounds (speech) the NPC is currently palying.

Equivalent to `Entity:EmitSound( "AI_BaseNPC.SentenceStop" )`

functions.name: SetArrivalSequence
functions.description: Sets the sequence to be played when the NPC arrives at its goal.

arguments.name: seq
arguments.description: See <page>Entity:LookupSequence</page>.

functions.name: SetArrivalSpeed
functions.description: Sets the arrival speed? of the NPC

arguments.name: speed

name: Panel
description:
This is the base panel for every other [VGUI](vgui) panel.

It contains all of the basic methods, some of which may only work on certain VGUI elements. As their functionality is provided at the game's C/C++ level rather than by its Lua script extension, they are unfortunately unavailable for most practical purposes, however, they can still be obtained in a way similar to that provided by the <page>baseclass</page> library:

```
-- Create a new panel type NewPanel that inherits all of its functionality from DLabel,
-- but has a different SetText method than DLabel does - all without the hassle of that
-- old DLabel's default text getting in the way. Fun stuff.

local PANEL = {}

function PANEL:Init()

self:SetText_Base( "" )
self:SetText( "Time for something different!" )

end

function PANEL:Paint( aWide, aTall )

local TextX, TextY = 0, 0
local TextColor = Color( 255, 0, 0, 255 )

surface.SetFont( self:GetFont() or "default" )
surface.SetTextColor( TextColor )
surface.SetTextPos( TextX, TextY )
surface.DrawText( self:GetText() )

end

-- And here we go:
PANEL.SetText_Base = FindMetaTable( "Panel" ).SetText

function PANEL:SetText( aText )

self.Text = tostring( aText )

end

function PANEL:GetText()

return self.Text or ""

end

vgui.Register( "NewPanel", PANEL, "DLabel" )
```

functions.name: IsLoading
functions.description:
Determines whether or not a <page>HTML</page> or <page>DHTML</page> element is currently loading a page.

<note>Before calling <page>Panel:SetHTML</page> or <page>DHTML:OpenURL</page>, the result seems to be `false` with the Awesomium web renderer and `true` for the Chromium web renderer. This difference can be used to determine the available HTML5 capabilities.</note>
<note>On Awesomium, the result remains `true` until the root document is loaded and when in-page content is loading (when adding pictures, frames, etc.). During this state, the HTML texture is not refreshed and the panel is not painted (it becomes invisible).

On Chromium, the value is only `true` when the root document is not ready. The rendering is not suspended when in-page elements are loading.</note>

* [waitarrow](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=waitarrow)
* [crosshair](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=crosshair)
* [up](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=up)
* [sizenwse](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=sizenwse)
* [sizenesw](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=sizenesw)
* [sizewe](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=sizewe)
* [sizens](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=sizens)
* [sizeall](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=sizeall)
* [no](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=no)
* [hand](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=hand)
* [blank](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=blank)

Set to anything else to set it to "none", the default fallback. Do note that a value of "none" does not, as one might assume, result in no cursor being drawn - hiding the cursor requires a value of "blank" instead.

arguments.description:
The panel class to override the default <page>DTooltip</page>. The new panel class must have the following methods:
* <page text="SetText">Panel:SetText</page> - If you are using <page>Panel:SetTooltip</page>.
* <page text="SetContents">DTooltip:SetContents</page> - If you are using <page>Panel:SetTooltipPanel</page>.
* <page text="OpenForPanel">DTooltip:OpenForPanel</page> - A "hook" type function that gets called shortly after creation (and after the above 2) to open and position the tooltip. You can see this logic in `lua/includes/util/tooltips.lua`.

functions.name: CalculateVelocityOffset

<warning>This will return zero length vectors if the physics object's motion is disabled. See <page>PhysObj:IsMotionEnabled</page>.</warning>

arguments.name: position

returnValues.description: The calculated linear velocity from the impulse on the physics object's center of mass in `source_unit/s`. (World frame)
The calculated angular velocity from the impulse on the physics object's center of mass in `degrees/s`. (Local frame)

functions.name: SteamID64
functions.description:
Returns the player's full **64-bit SteamID**, also known as **CommunityID**. Information on how data is packed into this value can be found [here](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/SteamID).

See <page>Player:AccountID</page> for a function that returns only the Account ID part of the SteamID and <page>Player:SteamID</page> for the text version of the SteamID.

<note>In a `-multirun` environment, this will return `"0"` for all "copies" of a player because they are not authenticated with Steam.

For bots, this will return `90071996842377216` (equivalent to `STEAM_0:0:0`) for the first bot to join.

For each additional bot, the number increases by 1. So the next bot will be `90071996842377217` (`STEAM_0:1:0`) then `90071996842377218` (`STEAM_0:0:1`) and so on.</note>

returnValues.description:
Player's 64-bit SteamID aka CommunityID.

<note>The return value is a string, not a number, since Lua's numbers are unable to store the entire 64bit numbers without data loss.</note>

It is **highly** recommended to use Player:SteamID64 or Player:SteamID instead, which are guaranteed to be unique to each player. Returns a 32 bit integer that remains constant for a player across joins/leaves and across different servers. This can be used when a string is inappropriate - e.g. in a database primary key. In Singleplayer, this function will always return 1.

functions.name: Distance
functions.description:
Returns the Euclidean distance between the vector and the other vector.

<note>This function is more expensive than <page>Vector:DistToSqr</page>. However, please see the notes for <page>Vector:DistToSqr</page> before using it as squared distances are not the same as euclidean distances.</note>

arguments.name: otherVector
arguments.description: The vector to get the distance to.

returnValues.description: Distance between the vectors.

functions.name: Dot
functions.description:
Returns the [dot product](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dot_product#Geometric_definition) of this vector and the passed one. The dot product of two vectors is the product of their magnitudes (lengths), and the cosine of the angle between them:

**a b** = |**a**| |**b**| cos()

where **a** and **b** are vectors.

See Vector:Length for obtaining magnitudes. A dot product returns just the cosine of the angle if both vectors are normalized, and zero if the vectors are at right angles to each other.

arguments.name: otherVector
arguments.description: The vector to calculate the dot product with

returnValues.description: The dot product between the two vectors

functions.name: Length2DSqr
functions.description:
Returns the squared length of the vectors x and y value, x + y.

This is faster than <page>Vector:Length2D</page> as calculating the square root is an expensive process.

returnValues.description: Squared length of the vector in two dimensions

arguments.description: The passenger role. ( 1 is the driver )

returnValues.description: The seat position
The seat angle

functions.name: GetSteeringDegrees
functions.description: Returns the maximum steering degree of the vehicle

returnValues.description: The maximum steering degree of the vehicle

functions.name: HasBrakePedal
functions.description: Returns whether this vehicle has a brake pedal. See <page>Vehicle:SetHasBrakePedal</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether this vehicle has a brake pedal or not.

functions.name: IsBoosting
functions.description: Returns whether this vehicle is currently boosting or not.

returnValues.description: Whether this vehicle is currently boosting or not.

functions.name: IsEngineStarted
functions.description: Returns whether the engine is started or not.

returnValues.description: Whether the engine is started or not.

functions.name: SetCameraDistance
functions.description: Sets the third person camera distance of the vehicle.

arguments.name: distance
arguments.description: Camera distance to set to

functions.name: SetVehicleParams
functions.description:
Sets the vehicle parameters for given vehicle.

<note>Not all variables from the <page>Structures/VehicleParams</page> can be set.</note>

arguments.name: params
arguments.description: The new new vehicle parameters. See <page>Structures/VehicleParams</page>.

functions.name: GetInverseTR
functions.description:
Returns an inverted matrix without modifying the original matrix. This function will not fail, but only works correctly on matrices that contain only translation and/or rotation.

Using this function on a matrix with modified scale may return an incorrect inverted matrix.

To get the inverse of a matrix that contains other modifications, see <page>VMatrix:GetInverse</page>.

returnValues.description: The inverted matrix.

functions.name: GetScale
functions.description: Returns the absolute scale of the matrix.

returnValues.description: Absolute scale of the matrix

functions.name: GetTranslation
functions.description: Returns the absolute translation of the matrix.

returnValues.description: Absolute translation of the matrix

functions.name: IsRotationMatrix
functions.description:
Returns whether the matrix is a rotation matrix or not.

Technically it checks if the forward, right and up vectors are orthogonal and normalized.

returnValues.description: Is the matrix a rotation matrix or not

functions.name: IsZero
functions.description: Checks whenever all fields of the matrix are 0, aka if this is a [null matrix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zero_matrix).

returnValues.description: If the matrix is a null matrix.

functions.name: Mul
functions.description: Multiplies this matrix by given matrix.

arguments.name: input
arguments.description: The input matrix to multiply by.

functions.name: Set
functions.description: Copies values from the given matrix object.

arguments.name: src
arguments.description: The matrix to copy values from.

functions.name: SetAngles
functions.description: Sets the absolute rotation of the matrix.

arguments.name: angle
arguments.description: New angles.

functions.name: SetUnpacked
functions.description: Sets each component of the matrix.

functions.name: SetUp
functions.description:
Sets the up direction of the matrix.

ie. The third column of the matrix, excluding the w coordinate.

arguments.name: forward
arguments.description: The up direction of the matrix.

functions.name: Sub
functions.description: Subtracts given matrix from this matrix.

arguments.name: input
arguments.description: The input matrix to subtract.

functions.name: ToTable
functions.description: Converts the matrix to a 4x4 table. See <page>Global.Matrix</page> function.

returnValues.description: The 4x4 table.

functions.name: Clip2
functions.description:
Returns how much secondary ammo is in the magazine.
<note>This is not shared between clients and will instead return the maximum secondary clip size.</note>

returnValues.description: The amount of secondary ammo in the magazine.

functions.name: DefaultReload
functions.description:
Forces the weapon to reload while playing given animation.
<note>
This will stop the <page>Weapon:Think</page> function from getting called while the weapon is reloading!
</note>

arguments.name: act
arguments.description: Sequence to use as reload animation. Uses the <page>Enums/ACT</page>.

returnValues.description: Did reloading actually take place

functions.name: GetPrimaryAmmoType
functions.description: Gets the primary ammo type of the given weapon.

returnValues.description: The ammo type ID, or -1 if not found.

functions.name: SetActivity
functions.description:
Sets the activity the weapon is playing.

See also <page>Weapon:GetActivity</page>.

arguments.name: act
arguments.description: The new activity to set, see <page>Enums/ACT</page>.
